newsitem.title: USA: U.S. agencies say GM to begin Cadillac recall.
newsitem.headline: U.S. agencies say GM to begin Cadillac recall.

text.p: Two U.S. government agencies said on Tuesday that General Motors Corp will start notifying car owners this week of the recall of most Cadillacs with 4.9 liter engines manufactured between 1991 and 1995.
The U.S. Justice Department and the Environmental Protection Agency said the previously announced recall will begin and will potentially affect 587,000 vehicles.

The automaker has agreed to have Cadillac dealers replace a computer chip in the emission control system that causes carbon monoxide emissions up to three times the legal limit when the climate control system is used, the two agencies said, adding that the new computer chip will cut emissions by more than 50 percent.

GM in November agreed to the recall to settle claims it had violated federal clean air laws. The settlement, approved by a federal judge in April, also required GM to pay $11 million in civil penalties and spend an additional $7 million on projects that reduce air pollution from automobiles.
